stories.text:
The idea is to embed an iOS app in a web page (e.g., like embedding a YouTube video) so that people can try it in a sandboxed demo mode directly from Safari on their Mac/iPad/iPhone.

Unlike App Clips, this would work with all iOS apps unless the developer opts out.

Moreover, it would be more convenient for the user. The app would be part of the web page just like an embedded YouTube video.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why doesn't Apple allow you to embed an iOS app in a web page as a demo?

stories.text:
In the past I have had managers whose 1:1 meetings were worse than useless. But a couple managers I've had over my career ran excellent 1:1s. What makes a good 1:1?

The best one stayed in the room after and took notes, so it always seemed like he had a god-like big picture view. But I can't recall what else made it good, and what we covered.
stories.title: Ask HN: What makes a good 1-on-1
